item.title: Report E-2024090078
item.description:
Report E-2024090078

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-08T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-05
  • City: PLAINFIELD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that due to a nail puncture, approximately 1-gallon of Hydrochloric Acid 9% (hazardous - UN1789) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. The terminal advised they already cleaned and contained the release. The released product, damaged pail, and oil-dri was placed into a 20-gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

item.title: Report E-2024090061
item.description:
Report E-2024090061

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-30
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-BIN notified ERTS of a cargo release. ERTS dispatched a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. The contractor arrived on-site and confirmed approximately 1 cup of product were released affecting a 1’x1’ area of the trailer floor. The contractor collected and containerized the NOROX® DCP-40CC & -40BKC organic peroxide and all clean-up debris into one (1) 95-gallon drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
